During the period I was at PET da Comput: During the period I was at PET da Computação - UFSC, I gained experience in the area of scientific initiation with the Dependency Rule Modeling project for Multiple Aspects Trajectories, I also worked as a coordinator of digital content, supporting teachers in creating websites and managing social media of PET. I joined as a volunteer in the first semester of my graduation and became a scientific initiation scholarship holder in the second semester.
Internship in a security laboratory: Scholarship Holder in a Security Laboratory
My experience at the Computer Security L: My experience at the Computer Security Laboratory began working with the Brazilian digital signature standard. In an application development project for validating digital documents. The main objective of this Research Project was to provide a specialized solution that meets the specific legislation of Brazilian bodies in the context of digital signatures for validating digitally signed electronic documents of a specific nature. I worked mainly on the creation of a mobile application that validates a document through requests by reading a qrCode.
UFSC - Universidade Federal de Santa Cat: UFSC - Universidade Federal de Santa Catarina
Dependency Rule Modeling for Multiple As: Dependency Rule Modeling for Multiple Aspects Trajectories
The main objective of this Research Proj: The main objective of this Research Project is to provide a specialized solution that meets the specific legislation of Brazilian bodies in the context of digital signatures for validating digitally signed electronic documents of a specific nature.
In Brazil, the use of digital signatures: In Brazil, the use of digital signatures in electronic documents is regulated through Provisional Measure No. 2,200-2. Signed electronic documents permeate various aspects of society, such as contracts between entities, medical prescriptions, legal documents and invoices, and providing professional assistance in a fully digitized environment poses a series of challenges, among which stand out the need to guarantee the authenticity, integrity and veracity of documents used by service providers and their consumers.
In its electronic form, it is necessary: In its electronic form, it is necessary that such documents are obtained and verified by the recipients in an agile and safe way, the whole process involves the validation of qualitative attributes of the people who sign a health document, therefore, we have to place new elements in evidence of something new to be done at ICP-Brasil in a structured way.
Teleworking poses challenges, in pandemi: Teleworking poses challenges, in pandemic times, this modality makes it possible to reduce the risk of transmission of pathologies between professionals and the population served. Teleworking, combined with the technologies used to make this modality possible, provides and enables the provision of assistance in remote or difficult-to-access environments. It is observed that there is currently limited support for the practice of telecommuting in certain institutions. Thus, it is important to encourage research in this line, to study the issuance of signed receipts, particularly standardized methods to allow the creation of an artifact that enables the user to prove that, at a certain point, a digitally signed document was subjected to a digital signature verification service, makes it possible to provide solutions that serve society in general.
Trajectories of moving objects are usual: Trajectories of moving objects are usually modeled as sequences of space-time points or, in case of semantic trajectories, as labeled stops and moves. Data analytics methods on these kinds of trajectories tend to discover geometrical and temporal patterns, or simple semantic patterns based on the labels of stops and moves. A recent extension of semantic trajectories is called multiple aspects trajectory, i.e., a trajectory associated to different semantic dimensions called aspects. This kind of trajectory increases in a large scale the number of discovered patterns.
This project introduced the concept of d: This project introduced the concept of dependency rule to represent patterns discovered from the analysis of trajectories with multiple aspects. They included patterns related to a trajectory, trajectory points, or the moving object. These rules are conceptually represented as an extension of a conceptual model for multiple aspects trajectories. A case study shows that the proposal is relevant as it represents the discovered rules with a concise but expressive conceptual model. Additionally, a performance evaluation showed the feasibility of the conceptual model designed over relational-based database management technologies.
In this project, I was able to delve dee: In this project, I was able to delve deeper into the execution of benchmarks to test the performance of both SQL and NewSQL DBMS’s. Using the “OLTPBenchmark” tool, I implemented some query settings for PostgreSQL and VoltDB databases, and tested the performance of both with different amounts of data. The focus was to have a performance comparison between a NewSQL DBMS and an SQL DBMS.
In this project I worked on the developm: In this project I worked on the development of a digital document validator, with an initial focus on medical certificates and prescriptions. In the beginning, I worked in the research area, looking for a way to implement the validation API in an application for mobile devices, I started trying to use OpenSSL to validate attribute certificates offline in the application (which was implemented in Flutter with the implementation of the validator in the application having been done in Java), but at the time OpenSSL did not have enough support to make the validator work correctly, so a different way had to be found.
During this period, I started to focus o: During this period, I started to focus on the validator application, which started to have validation only online through requests for the validator api configured with an endpoint, from then on, I started to work alone in the application, implementing what was requested by the ITI (National Institute of Information Technology).
In this project I worked on the developm: In this project I worked on the development of a Student Management System using Django4, with the main objective of learning the framework and its functionalities. I used this project to learn more about the web development area.
My focus in this project was centralized: My focus in this project was centralized in the implementation of a User Authentication system, first I started implementing the student management system, which was too simple but very good to learn the basics of the framework and then I moved on to my idea, I initially implemented a zero authentication, functional but insecure the way it was, so I decided to implement it in a more secure way, which was using the Allauth lib, with this way it was much simpler and as the security part was practically ready, I chose this way as final for being more efficient.
The main idea of the project is to creat: The main idea of the project is to create a music streaming application, where the user can listen to songs, create playlists, check the lyrics of the song, among other features, the project itself is a way for me to learn more about web development and dig deeper into some technologies.
The initial implementation would be thro: The initial implementation would be through the creation of an HTTP server from scratch, however because it is something quite complex and that would take some time to be done effectively and functionally, I decided to implement an HTTP server in another project and focus on that project using the Django Framework.
The main idea of this project is to crea: The main idea of this project is to create an alternative game mode for the acclaimed Warframe game, the new game mode is in the Idle style, where the player does not necessarily need to be playing all the time to be able to progress in it, the idea came up by the creators of this project (Me, @ThiagoCComelli and @MatheusAHM). So we decided to put the project into practice, initially I separated several ideas and stored them in the trello shared by us, after that we started the implementation of a prototype that is currently under development.
The project is being developed with Reac: The project is being developed with React, NodeJS, JavaScript/TypeScript, HTML and CSS/SCSS, the main idea came with the purpose of being a way to learn more and more with these technologies, in addition to being a project that motivates us on account of being something related to a game that we like a lot, which ends up making learning and development more fun.
